  Networking and Communication Lab. (NCL) in IIIT-Bangalore mainly focuses on
  various R&D areas related to broadband wireless network. Recent major
  areas of work include Power Saving in devices and base stations by New
  Protocols, multi-Radio Access Technology (RAT selection), Cognitive Radio,
  TVWS, scheduling schemes in LTE-A and Beyond, MAC for IoT devices as well as
  secured Transport layer. This lab was created in Jan. 2007 by research fund
  from Hewlett Packard, Motorola India Research Labs. Later on the Lab received
  research funding from Microsoft, Nokia, Intel, Siemens, DeitY-Government of
  India to work on various challenging problems in niche areas of broadband
  Wireless Network. This lab has already produced four PhDs and nine MS by
  Research (MSR) theses over last 8 years. Seven students are pursuing PhD. 
  
  Current ongoing sponsored research activities are:
  
  1. IoT, SDN and Secured Technologies for Smart Building � Sponsored by
  Cognizant Technologies and Dept. of Electronics and Information Technology
  (DeitY), Govt of India. 
  
  2. Inter-Operability of IoT Devices � Sponsored by Nokia Inc. 
  
  3. Green Broadband Wireless MAC and Spectrum Allocation for LTE-A and Beyond
  � Sponsored by Dept. of Electronics and Information Technology (DeitY), Govt
  of India. 
  
  The previous sponsored projects are given in a Projects page
  
  Lab-in-Charge: Dr. Debabrata Das
